source.description: A genus of bacteria that is beneficial to gut health and is often associated with higher expression of metabolism-related genes.

candidates: Fatty Acid Metabolism Pathway in Inflammatory Bowel Disease

target.entity_name: Fatty Acid Metabolism Pathway in IBD
target.description: A metabolic pathway involving the breakdown and synthesis of fatty acids, significant in the context of IBD and treatment.

description: An increased abundance of Bifidobacterium is associated with higher expression of genes involved in fatty acid metabolism.

source.description: A genus of bacteria that is associated with increased metallothionein signaling in the gut.

candidates: Metallothionein Pathway in Inflammatory Bowel Disease
target.description: A signaling pathway involving metallothionein proteins that may play a role in intestinal health and disease.

description: Bacteroides correlates with increased metallothionein signaling.

source.description: A genus of bacteria associated with immunoregulatory genes in non-stenotic tissue of IBD patients.

target.description: n/a entity was created by relationship disambiguator

description: A transcriptional network dominated by immunoregulatory genes is associated with Lachnoclostridium bacteria in non-stenotic tissue.

source.description: A family of bacteria linked to fatty acid metabolism genes in patients using TNF-α-antagonists.

candidates: Fatty Acid Metabolism Pathway in Inflammatory Bowel Disease
Fatty Acid Synthesis and Degradation Pathway
target.entity_name: Fatty Acid Metabolism Pathway in IBD
target.description: A metabolic pathway involving the breakdown and synthesis of fatty acids, significant in the context of IBD and treatment.

description: A transcriptional network dominated by fatty acid metabolism genes is linked to Ruminococcaceae in patients using TNF-α-antagonists.
